channel.title: One nation indivisible
channel.description:
A documentary series about nationalism in the 20th century.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: The Philippines
item.description: The Philippines: Independence and security are achieved under the sponsorship of a colonial power. Features Ramon Magsaysay, late president of the Philippines.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: China
item.description: China: The ideal of national unity grows slowly under the impact of the West and is exploited by communism.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Ghana
item.description: Ghana: The first African nation to achieve independence in the British Commonwealth faces unique problems. Features Kwame Nkrumah, prime minister of Ghana.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Internationalism
item.description: Internationalism: Is world government the answer to the present dilemma and the conflict between modern national states?
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Russia
item.description: Russia: The national tradition is adapted to the demands of Soviet doctrine.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Ireland
item.description: Ireland, a country with ancient traditions, struggles for unity within the framework of national sovereignty.
item.dc:creator: Burrows, E. G. (Edwin Gladding), 1917-
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Indonesia
item.description: Indonesia: An island republic attempts to unify its disparate elements under the banner of anti-colonialism. Features Achmed Sukarno, president of Indonesia.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Hungary
item.description: Hungary: A Soviet satellite country seeks to reaffirm its faith in its national ideals.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Japan
item.description: Japan: Nationalism carried to the extreme drives a nation into disastrous war.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: India
item.description: India: The concept of civil disobedience helps a colonial country achieve independence. Features G.L. Mehta, ambassador of India to the United States.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Rise of nationalism
item.description: This program, "The Rise of Nationalism," provides a general overview of nationalism throughout the world, past and present.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Egypt
item.description: Egypt: Culture, religion and the search for a national entity involve a newly independent country in the larger struggle between East and West. Features Gamal Abdel Nasser, president of Egypt.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: North Africa
item.description: North Africa: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia. Features Abdel Kader Chanderli of the Algerian Front of National Liberation; Moncef Kedade, consul of Tunisia; Mohammed el Kohen, consul general of Morocco.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: World Politics
